title: How to Make Healthy Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
steps.description: Place the oven racks in the upper and lower third of the oven. Line 2 cookie sheets with foil.

steps.headline: Stir together; the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon, in a large mixing bowl.
Beat the softened butter and sugar together in a medium mixing bowl with a spoon or a spatula.
steps.description: One at a time add; an egg, applesauce, and vanilla extract. Stir the ingredients thoroughly after each addition.

steps.headline: Blend the oats and/or nuts in a blender.
Stir in; the oats, nuts, and the flour mixture, one ingredient at a time.
Beat the flour/oat mixture together with the sugar mixture.
Add the chocolate chips or raisins.
Drop the dough by spoons about 2 inches (5.1 cm) apart on the prepared sheets.
Bake the cookies until they are dull on he surface but still soft, about 10-12 minutes.
Remove the cookies from the pan onto a rack and wait for it to cool.

text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place the oven racks in the upper and lower third of the oven. Line 2 cookie sheets with foil. Stir together; the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon, in a large mixing bowl. Set aside for later. Beat the softened butter and sugar together in a medium mixing bowl with a spoon or a spatula. One at a time add; an egg, applesauce, and vanilla extract. Stir the ingredients thoroughly after each addition. Blend the oats and/or nuts in a blender.  Stir in; the oats, nuts, and the flour mixture, one ingredient at a time.  Beat the flour/oat mixture together with the sugar mixture.  Add the chocolate chips or raisins.  Drop the dough by spoons about 2 inches (5.1 cm) apart on the prepared sheets.  Bake the cookies until they are dull on he surface but still soft, about 10-12 minutes.  Remove the cookies from the pan onto a rack and wait for it to cool. Makes about 18 cookies
